content.title: Financial Assistance For Promotion Of Guru-Shishya Parampara (Repertory Grant)
content.beneficiary: Dramatic groups, theatre groups, music ensembles, children's theatre, and all genres of performing arts activities
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Promotion of Guru-Shishya Parampara (Repertory Grant)' was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. Under this scheme, financial assistance will be provided to dramatic groups, theatre groups, music ensembles, children's theatre, and all genres of performing arts activities. The Ministry of Culture will evaluate the grantees through periodical inspections, field visits, etc. as may be felt necessary for the scheme on a periodical basis.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹15,000/- per month will be given to each Guru/Director.

Financial assistance to each Shisya/Artist will be given based on age group: ₹10,000/- for Adult Shisya/Artist, ₹7,500/- for A category child Shisya/Artist, ₹3,500/- for B category child Shisya/Artist, and ₹2,000/- for C category child Shisya/Artist.
eligibility: The arts activities performing organizations having dramatic groups, theatre groups, music ensembles, and children's theatre are eligible to apply under the scheme.
The group ensembles to be assisted with the scheme will be expected to have a repertoire of adequate number and quality and should have given performances on an all-India basis.
Organizations will be eligible to obtain only one grant in a financial year.
documents_required: Brief introduction of applicant organization along with press reviews, press advertisements, souvenir copies of tickets, etc. in respect of the previous year’s activities of the organization.
Photocopy of the Registration Certificate and Memorandum of Association/Deed, Bye-laws.
A copy of the Unique ID number of the organization obtained from the NGO-PS (NGO-DARPAN) Portal.
A copy of the Permanent Account Number (PAN) issued by the Income Tax Department.
Duly filled-in Resolution in the prescribed format (in original).

Duly filled in indemnity Bond in the prescribed format (in original), signed on every page by the authorized signatory with the stamp of the organization along with the signature of two witnesses with their name and complete address.
Complete details of Guru/Director and Shisya/Artists enrolled with the organization for which financial assistance is sought along with their respective bank account details.

Justification for seeking financial assistance as Fresh Financial Assistance for Promotion of Guru-Shishya Parampara (Repertory Grant) or Renewal of Financial Assistance for Promotion of Guru-Shishya Parampara (Repertory Grant) or Enhancement of Financial Assistance for Promotion of Guru-Shishya Parampara (Repertory Grant).
Last three years’ audited statement of accounts along with sources and pattern of receipt & payment and income & expenditure etc.
Last three years’ Income Tax Assessment orders.
Last three years’ balance sheet with auditor’s certificate.
Utilization Certificate (in original) in the prescribed format and receipts & payment statement (in original) issued by Chartered Accountant (CA).
Press reviews, press advertisements, souvenir copies of tickets, etc. of the productions of the previous years.

Documentary proof to the effect that the grantee organization has transferred the cash component of the last year’s grant received electronically against the bank account of each and every individual beneficiary.
A duly filled-in and signed prescribed Bank Proforma/Authorization letter.
Duly filled-in checklist accompanied with the application form.
The application should be duly recommended by concerned State Governments /U.T. Administrations or any of the State Academies or National Academies.
Annual action plan of the organization indicating details of at least two cultural activities organized by the organization in any of the schools in their vicinity.

faqs.question: What is the 'Financial Assistance For Promotion Of Guru-Shishya Parampara (Repertory Grant)' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance will be provided to dramatic groups, theatre groups, music ensembles, children's theatre, and all genres of performing arts activities.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Is this Central Sector Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a Central Sector Scheme.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be given to each Guru of the organization under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹15,000/- per month will be given to each Guru/Director.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be given to each Shisya/Artist under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Financial assistance of ₹2,000/- to ₹10,000/- will be given to each Shisya/Artist as per age group.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Professional organizations of dramatic groups, theatre groups, music ensembles, children's theatre, and all genres of performing arts activities are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How many times the grant will be given to an organization in a financial year?
faqs.answer: Organizations will be eligible to obtain only one grant in a financial year.

faqs.question: How shall the grant be disbursed?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance under the scheme will be disbursed in one installment on fulfillment of conditions at the time of proposal for renewal of the grant.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for an organization to organize cultural activities in a school?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Organisations granted financial assistance would mandatorily organize at least two cultural activities in any of the schools in their vicinity.

faqs.question: What will be the pre-requisite condition for renewal of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Organizations getting financial assistance under the scheme are required to upload videos of their Production/Function/Seminar etc. on YouTube and provide a link to the Ministry of Culture.

faqs.question: Where can an organization find the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form can be downloaded from the official website of the Ministry of Culture.

faqs.question: How can an organization apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The hard copy of the application along with all the necessary enclosures should be sent to 'The Director, National School of Drama, Bahawalpur House, Plot No. 1, Bhagwan Das Road, New Delhi-110001'.
